STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 18, 2024
Tracey Silas
KENT COUNTY DHHS
121 MARTIN LUTHER KING JR ST SE,
GRAND RAPIDS, MI, 49507-1132
Re: License #: CP410201222
Dear Tracey Silas:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
July 15, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
• (5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the
evaluation, an agency shall complete a written report
that includes all the following information:
One of two special investigation reports reviewed did not have the report completed
within 15 days of the conclusion of the investigation.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the
evaluation, an agency shall complete a written report
that includes all the following information:
(d) Findings of fact, based upon the evaluation.
One of two special investigation reports reviewed did not have accurate findings of
fact based on information contained in the investigation.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
2

The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Be sure to include documentation of interviews completed or documents
reviewed that support the decision special evaluations finding of fact section.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency renewal inspection was completed on 6/22/2023 and the CAP was
approved on 7/3/2023. The agency was cited for 1 violation, none of which were
repeated this year however did involve special evaluations. In 2022, there were no
violations. The agency will need to establish corrective planning regarding special
investigations to ensure compliance.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. The chief administrator
indicated the agency has had no barriers in achieving compliance. There was one
violation from the previous year audit regarding special evaluations. As a result,
the agency implemented a process to track and monitor completion of evaluations
along with adequate oversight and follow up to ensure the evaluations are
completed and sent timely. The agency continues to complete licensing of homes
through request of ICPC and collaborate with PAFC providers to recruit and retain
licensed families through licensing events.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
An interview was conducted with one staff face-to-face at the agency. Staff
reported feeling supported by the agency. Supervisors and coworkers are
3

available to assist and discuss any issues as they arise. Staff did not report any
concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of licensing and adoption services. All files were stored securely and there
is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert: The licensed foster home did not respond to repeated attempts to
schedule a home visit to assess safety of the home for the DCWL audit.
Resolution: Foster care staff attempted telephone contact and conducted an
unannounced home visit but were unsuccessful. A special evaluation was initiated
on 3/28/2024. Eventually contact was made and a home visit was scheduled and
completed with CPA Agency Analyst.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
_________7/16/2024_________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
